showScoreExcerpt:
"The three sexagenarians go on trying to keep up appearances in typically English middle-class style as the tension builds under James Macdonald’s taut direction...
Their clash here symbolizes a larger debate about the privilege of the postwar generation...Kirkwood’s play provocatively asks whether such fortunate golden-agers might not consider sacrificing themselves for the sake of the young. That modest proposal ought to make a few waves on Broadway."
